Package software.leonov.common.collect

Class Iteration

  • java.lang.Object
    • software.leonov.common.collect.Iteration
  • public final class Iteration
extends Object
    Static utility methods for working with Iterables and Iterators
    Author:
    Zhenya Leonov
    See Also:
    Maps, MoreMaps, Collections, Collections2, Lists, MoreLists, Sets, Iterables, Iterators, Iteration, Queues, MoreQueues, Arrays, ObjectArrays, MoreArrays

      • emptyListIterator

        public static <E> ListIterator<E> emptyListIterator()
        Returns an immutable empty ListIterator.

        Note: Java 7+ users should prefer Collections.emptyListIterator().

        Type Parameters:

        Returns:
        an immutable empty ListIterator

      • in

        public static <T> Iterable<T> in​(Iterator<T> iterator)
        Deprecated.
        Jave 8+ users can create an Iterable from an Iterator using Java's lambda facility, for example: 
         for (final String s : (Iterable<String>)() -> iterator) {
    ...
 }
        A convenience method which adapts an iterator to the Iterable interface suitable for using in Java 5+ for-each loops.

        Warning: Although not explicitly stated in the documentation it is generally assumed that an Iterable object is able to produce multiple independent Iterators. Thus the returned Iterable does not behave like a general purpose Iterable because it supports only a single call to Iterable.iterator(). Invoking the iterator() method to obtain subsequent iterators will result in an IllegalStateException.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        iterator - the underlying iterator
        Returns:
        an Iterable which returns the underlying iterator on the first call to Iterable.iterator()

      • sample

        public static <T> List<T> sample​(Iterable<? extends T> population,
                                 int k)
        Returns a random sample of k elements from the given Iterable using reservoir sampling.

        If k exceeds the size of the given iterable the returned list will contain all of its elements.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        population - the given Iterable
        k - the number of random items to chose
        Returns:
        a random sample of k elements from the given Iterable

      • sample

        public static <T> List<T> sample​(Iterable<? extends T> population,
                                 int k,
                                 Random random)
        Returns a random sample of k elements from the given Iterable using reservoir sampling.

        If k exceeds the size of the given iterable the returned list will contain all of its elements.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the element type
        Parameters:
        population - the given Iterable
        k - the number of random items to chose
        random - the Random number generator
        Returns:
        a random sample of k elements from the given Iterable

      • transform

        public static <E,​T> ListIterator<T> transform​(ListIterator<E> from,
                                                    Function<? super E,​? extends T> function)
        Returns a ListIterator that applies the specified Function to each element of the given list iterator.

        The returned list iterator does not support add(E) and set(E) but does support remove() if the given list iterator does.

        Type Parameters:
        E - the element type traversed by the given list iterator
        T - the type of output of the specified function
        Parameters:
        from - the given list iterator
        function - the specified function
        Returns:
        a list iterator that applies function to each element of fromIterator

      • unmodifiable

        public static <E> UnmodifiableListIterator<E> unmodifiable​(ListIterator<? extends E> listIterator)
        Decorates the specified ListIterator to prevent remove(), add(E), and set(E).
        Type Parameters:
        E - the element type
        Parameters:
        listIterator - the underlying ListIterator
        Returns:
        an unmodifiable view of listIterator

      • unmodifiable

        Type Parameters:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • concat

        public static <E> Iterable<E> concat​(E first,
                                     Iterable<? extends E> rest)
        Returns an unmodifiable iterable which combines a single element with the specified iterable. The returned iterable produces iterators that lazily traverse the first element followed by the rest of the elements.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the element type
        Parameters:
        first - the first element
        rest - the rest of the elements
        Returns:
        an iterable which combines a single element with the specified iterable

      • concat

        public static <E> Iterable<E> concat​(Iterable<? extends E> first,
                                     E last)
        Returns an unmodifiable iterable which combines the specified iterable with a single element. The returned iterable produces iterators that lazily traverse all the first elements followed by last.
        Type Parameters:
        E - the element type
        Parameters:
        first - the first elements
        last - the last element
        Returns:
        an iterable which combines the specified iterable with a single element
